headline.main: Yemen Says Aden Airport to Reopen in Weeks After Refurbishment
headline.print_headline: Yemen Says Aden Airport to Reopen in Weeks After Refurbishment

docs.snippet: Aden airport is expected to reopen fully for commercial traffic within weeks, Yemen's information minister said, a move that would shore up confidence in the ability of President Abd-Rabbu Mansour Hadi's government to control the volatile city....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aden airport is expected to reopen fully for commercial traffic within weeks, Yemen's information minister said, a move that would shore up confidence in the ability of President Abd-Rabbu Mansour Hadi's government to control the volatile city.

headline.main: Syria's Opposition Says Will Stick to Truce Despite Violations
headline.print_headline: Syria's Opposition Says Will Stick to Truce Despite Violations

docs.snippet: Syria's opposition will stick to the cessation of hostilities despite what they said were 15 violations by Syrian government forces on Saturday and more breaches on Sunday, a spokesman for the High Negotiating Committee (HNC) said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syria's opposition will stick to the cessation of hostilities despite what they said were 15 violations by Syrian government forces on Saturday and more breaches on Sunday, a spokesman for the High Negotiating Committee (HNC) said.

headline.main: Syria's Onetime 'Capital of the Revolution' Now a Ghost Town
headline.print_headline: Syria's Onetime 'Capital of the Revolution' Now a Ghost Town

docs.snippet: Two years after the last Syrian rebels left the besieged Old City of Homs, voices echo through the shells of bombed-out buildings, their upper floors tilted at odd angles as though frozen in time....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two years after the last Syrian rebels left the besieged Old City of Homs, voices echo through the shells of bombed-out buildings, their upper floors tilted at odd angles as though frozen in time.

headline.main: Bangladesh Police Raid Suspected Militant Hideout, Find Explosives
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Police Raid Suspected Militant Hideout, Find Explosives

docs.snippet: Bangladesh police seized explosives and bomb-making materials on Sunday from a hideout used by Jama'atul-Mujahideen militants believed to be behind a spate of recent attacks in the south Asian nation, a police spokesman said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bangladesh police seized explosives and bomb-making materials on Sunday from a hideout used by Jama'atul-Mujahideen militants believed to be behind a spate of recent attacks in the south Asian nation, a police spokesman said.

headline.main: Indian Man Kills 14 Members of Own Family, Then Hangs Himself
headline.print_headline: Indian Man Kills 14 Members of Own Family, Then Hangs Himself

docs.snippet: A man in India stabbed 14 members of his own family to death, including seven children, before hanging himself, police said on Sunday, in one of the country's worst - and grizzliest - massacres in recent years....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man in India stabbed 14 members of his own family to death, including seven children, before hanging himself, police said on Sunday, in one of the country's worst - and grizzliest - massacres in recent years.

headline.main: Britain's Ruling Conservatives Call for Truce in EU Campaign
headline.print_headline: Britain's Ruling Conservatives Call for Truce in EU Campaign

docs.snippet: Senior ministers called on Sunday for a truce in a heated debate on Britain's membership of the European Union, saying the ruling Conservative Party must be civil if it wants to stay in power....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senior ministers called on Sunday for a truce in a heated debate on Britain's membership of the European Union, saying the ruling Conservative Party must be civil if it wants to stay in power.

headline.main: EU Ambassadors Pay Respects to Slain Russian Politician
headline.print_headline: EU Ambassadors Pay Respects to Slain Russian Politician

docs.snippet: The ambassadors from European Union countries have paid their respects to slain Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov by visiting the makeshift memorial on the bridge where he was shot....
docs.lead_paragraph: The ambassadors from European Union countries have paid their respects to slain Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov by visiting the makeshift memorial on the bridge where he was shot.

headline.main: China Internet Watchdog Bans Former Tycoon's Microblog
headline.print_headline: China Internet Watchdog Bans Former Tycoon's Microblog

docs.snippet: China's cyberspace watchdog said on Sunday it had ordered the closure of a microblog account of a former property tycoon, known for his bold remarks on China's economic policy, for "spreading illegal information"....
docs.lead_paragraph: China's cyberspace watchdog said on Sunday it had ordered the closure of a microblog account of a former property tycoon, known for his bold remarks on China's economic policy, for "spreading illegal information".
